title: Textile, 1920s
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: dyed and printed
inscribed: Printed along edge: Soc. An. Fortuny
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 351 x 68 cm (11 ft. 6 3/16 in. x 26 3/4 in.)
description: The ground fabric has a marbled effect in shades of purple and pink, possibly achieved with a partial discharge technique, then overprinted with silver ink in a pattern of stylized flowers and vines.
justification: Fiore, a dyed and printed cotton, was designed by Fortuny in the 1920s,and more than likely woven on a narrow loom in his home. The Fortuny Factory, on the Guidecca in Venice, opened in 1922, and half-width fabrics such as this were discontinued completely in the mid-1920s. This piece was probably made by Fortuny himself in the late teens or early twenties. The pattern itself is based on a Persian silk pattern and continues to be made today, but not in this color combination. The ground fabric has a marbled effect in shades of purple and pink, possibly achieved with a partial discharge technique, and is then overprinted with silver ink in a pattern of stylized flowers and vines.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, 1920s.
1920s. Medium: cotton
Technique: dyed and printed. Gift of Esme Usdan. 2006-19-1.
